author: Long Nguyen
title: MinSwap - Multi-pool DEX
description: Currently, there isn't any DEX on Cardano and new projects don't have a place to bootstrap their token distribution.

assessments.note: I'm excited to use platforms like this when smart contracts go live, but there's a lot of competition: three DEXs in fund 5 and maybe two IDOs on Ethereum. What will be your competitive advantage?  A small airdrop would go a long way to get people interested and using the platform. Unfortunately I didn't understand your explanation of what a multi-pool is. Please expand on that.

A DEX is the ideal solution to encourage DeFi teams to deploy finance solutions and to scale up Cardano's DeFi ecosystem. This multi-pool DEX is particularly designed to onboard as much projects as possible within a set timeframe of 6 months. 
There is also the potential to work cross chain using an ERC-20 converter. 
The features that this DEX proposal offers are very interesting and would provide a win-win-win situation which our ecosystem aims for.
It does. DEXes are very important for DeFi. And it will help tokens take off on Cardano as it has on Ethereum.
This proposal effectively addresses the challenge by forking Uniswap and adding in some different pricing functions and a launch pad for new tokens' IDO and IFO.
This would be a great defi project in itself, but by also then enable others through it is definitely meets the challenge goal.

The problem and solution description is reasonable and clear and is within the scope of the challenge. There is a concise and objective plan. The goals and metrics established indicate a positive impact on the metrics of the challenge. The proposal describes the creation of a DEX in the AMM model and with a model that allows different mathematical functions for different pairs.
It seems like the team has the necessary experience. Your website looks good. With the fair distribution, I'm sure you'll get the backing of the community.

The team has relevant experience to achieve this proposal and have made verifications of this public on their website. 
The project is likely to succeed considering a broad diversity of features that it has to offer to distinguish itsself from competition. The proposal, website and whitepaper are written in a very clear structure, which brings to mind that the team work in a planned way and have attention to detail.
Seems like a good team and good ideas for what they want to do and how.

Given the plan to clone uniswap and merge it into a working DEX on Cardano, it isn't clear if the team has assessed the risks involved with moving onto a EUTXO, PoS blockchain vs an account modeled PoW blockchain. It isn't clear how the team will implement EUTXO on the swap. The team has talent currently being developed as plutus pioneer enrollees. The proposal doesn't include details on how the governance token will be used within the platform. trying to do both a dex and a luanch pad with low budget like this has risk of budget overages.
There is no background in functional programming in the team.
Reasonably detailed plan. It would be nice to have more evidence of capability (LinkedIn profiles) as this is a complex project to pull off well.

The team described extensive experience with software development, web development and software engineering. There are links to your Linkedins and Githubs where you can check the qualifications and expertise. The team is participating in the Plutus Pioneer Program, but there are no details on the team's experience in developing smart contracts.

The integration with SPOs to implement the concept of Babel Fees needs further clarification as the implementation of Babels Fees should not occur in the near future and this makes implementation in the short term unfeasible (within the 6 months that are the reference of this challenge). Nevertheless, it is a promising path for Cardano's DeFi ecosystem.

There is a detailed and reasonable budget.

With regards to IFOs, will the projects be screened by your team? IDOs similar to those on Uniswap can be permissionless, but it would be good to also have offerings where there is more trust because the projects have been vetted. You could talk more about security of funds.

The proposal is very information-efficient. Containing all necessary elements to asses and yet not elaborating too much to keep it short and to the point. 
The roadmap exists out of milestones with a given quarter when this is expected to succeed. 
The budget breakdown is logical and set correctly to cover expected initial costs.
Clear roadmap and whitepaper. The budget seems reasonable for the first 3 months, and it seems pretty clear how they will use the money and what to focus on.

The proposal identifies two separate problems, a dex and a launch pad. The team doesn't set goals for total value locked or yield %. The project's success will be auditable with whether or not it's functional.

There is clarity in the description of the problem, the solution and how they addresses the challenge.

There are relevant metrics for defining success. There are several details about the team, their qualifications (links to Linkedin and Github have been included) and budget allocation. The roadmap presents clear and relevant milestones. It would be interesting to add KPIs.

solution: Introducing MinSwap - a DEX on Cardano that supports multiple liquidity pool functions and initial token listing.
experience: The founder formerly worked as a software engineer at Amazon & Jenkins. Our team also has achieved Innovation Award at NEO Hackathon Tokyo.
